title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 24 Starlink satellites to polar orbit from California
summary: The mission will be SpaceX’s 480th Falcon 9 rocket launch to date. Launch teams are targeting a liftoff from Space Launch Complex 4 East at 9:14 a.m. PDT (12:14 p.m. EDT, 1614 UTC).

title: Summary of the 2024 SAGE III/ISS Meeting
summary: Introduction The Stratospheric Aerosol and Gas Experiment (SAGE) III/International Space Station [SAGEIII/ISS] Science Team Meeting (STM) took place on October 22–23, 2024, in a hybrid format. Approximately 50 scientists attended in person at NASA’s Langley Research Center (LaRC) – see Photo. Participants included researchers from U.S. universities, NASA LaRC, NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC), […]

title: Chinese commercial company lands contract to build provincial satellite constellation
summary:
Chinese commercial satellite manufacturer MinoSpace has won a major contract to build a remote sensing satellite constellation for Sichuan Province.

title: Waltzing celebration for half a century of European satellite tracking
summary: 2025 marks a landmark year for Europe’s ‘bridge between Earth and space’. ESA’s Estrack satellite tracking network turns 50 – and with it, its deep space antenna in Cebreros, Spain, celebrates 20 years of connecting Earth to the agency’s most distant missions.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 launch from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 12-22 mission will be the 45 Starlink mission of the year. SpaceX is targeting a liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 1:19 p.m. EDT (1719 UTC).

title: SpaceX blames Starship Flight 8 mishap on engine hardware failure
summary:
The failure of SpaceX’s Starship on its most recent test flight had a different root cause than the previous failure, despite happening at about the same time.

title: Raytheon secures $380 million contract extension for GPS ground control system
summary:
The Next Generation Operational Control System (OCX) is a critical software upgrade for the Global Positioning System (GPS) infrastructure and is now more than eight years behind schedule.
